item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 9th – Midday
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Arrest of ex-intelligence officer reveals new evidence of Russian infiltration across Europe
item.description: An arrest warrant for an Austrian suspect alleges that he handed over cellphone data of former high-ranking officials to Russian intelligence.

item.title: Rare protest rocks Russia after dam bursts near Kazakh border
item.description: Around 10,000 homes in the Orenburg region were flooded, with water levels continuing to rise, according to Russian state media.

item.title: 'Where is my home?': Destruction awaits Palestinians returning to Khan Younis
item.description: An estimated 55% of the buildings in south Gaza's Khan Younis area – around 45,000 buildings – have been destroyed or damaged, according to two mapping experts.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 9th – Morning
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: North Americans elated by total solar eclipse
item.description: The next total eclipse will be on 12 August 2026 and will cover large areas of the northern hemisphere.

item.title: Romanian right-wing parties join efforts ahead of EU elections
item.description: The bloc's goal is to challenge the country's governing alliance and the rising far-right movement across Europe.

item.title: WATCH: Protesters in Jerusalem demand 'hostage deal'
item.description: Hamas-led militants took about 250 captives when they crossed from Gaza into Israel on 7 October.

item.title: WATCH: footage of Khan Younis hospital as IDF withdraws
item.description: The forces withdrew to recuperate and prepare for future operations.

item.title: Czech government invests six billion euros in new nuclear reactors
item.description: The Czech government is investing in nuclear energy as a means to decarbonisation.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 8th – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Vatican calls gender-affirming surgery violations of human dignity
item.description: The Vatican's new doctrine put both gender-affirming surgery and surrogacy on par with abortion and euthanasia.

item.title: First German troops arrive in Lithuania
item.description: A permanent presence of around 4,800 soldiers is planned due to the changing security situation in Europe.

item.title: New Slovak president Peter Pellegrini yet to define political stance - analyst
item.description: The politician, an ally of pro-Moscow Prime Minister Robert Fico, won a recent presidential election in Slovakia the vote with 54%.

item.title: 'Shrouded in secrecy': Sweden expels Chinese journalist
item.description: Swedish authorities claim the reporter was a threat to national security.

item.title: Wildfires torch Greek island of Crete weeks before official fire season starts
item.description: Following one of the warmest winters on record, Greece tackled its first blaze of the year, nearly a month before the onset of the traditional May fire season.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 8th – Midday
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Parts of Kazakhstan and Russia declare state of emergency after 'worst floods in 80 years'
item.description: Sudden and early warm weather conditions triggered the flooding, leading to a massive snowmelt that overflowed numerous rivers in parts of Kazakhstan and Russia.

item.title: Poland's local election results preview tight EU elections
item.description: Local elections in Poland, where former ruling party Law and Justice won by a slight percentage margin, could serve as an early indication for the results of June's EU elections.

item.title: Germany faces war crime facilitation claims at The Hague, Israel withdraws troops from south Gaza
item.description: All the latest developments on the Israel Hamas war.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 8th – Morning
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: 'Dangerous provocation': Kremlin blasts Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant attack
item.description: Attacks on the Ukrainian nuclear power plant have significantly increased the risk of an accident, warned the International Atomic Energy Agency.

item.title: Yemen's Houthis say they launched missiles, rockets at Western ships
item.description: Yahya Saree, Yemeni Armed Forces spokesman, said in a televised statement that the operations took place ''during the last 72 hours''. He did not give further details of the attacks.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 7th – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Rwanda remembers genocide 30 years on in ceremony
item.description: World leaders around the world have marked the anniversary of the genocide of the Tutsi ethnic minority.

item.title: IDF quietly withdraws from southern Gaza strip
item.description: Israel's military said it was drawing back most forces from a Hamas stronghold in southern Gaza following a major phase of its offensive.

item.title: Thousands protest in Hungary against Viktor Orbán's government
item.description: Some media estimated about 100,000 participants, making it one of the two largest opposition political demonstrations in recent years.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 7th – Midday
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Poland's local elections test Tusk's new government
item.description: Poland's local elections test Donald Tusk's new government after 4 months in power.

item.title: Copenhagen residents dismantle Christiania's drug market
item.description: In the words of the Mayor of Copenhagen, for Christiania to exist, drug dealing and clashes have to stop. Residents have taken initiative.

item.title: Scholz warns of the rise of right-wing populists ahead of EU elections
item.description: Germany's Chancellor Olaf Scholz warns of the rise of right-wing populists ahead of EU elections.

item.title: Fresh round of ceasefire talks expected in Cairo
item.description: Negotiators prepare for another round of talks on brokering a ceasefire and securing the release of remaining hostages.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 7th – Morning
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Peter Pellegrini to become next Slovakian president
item.description: Peter Pellegrini is to become the next president of Slovakia amid divide in support for Ukraine war.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 6th – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Russian bombards Kharkiv overnight
item.description: Russian forces attacked Kharkiv overnight, killing several.

item.title: World Food Programme warns of imminent famine in northern Gaza
item.description: As the war in Gaza enters a sixth month, the WFP said malnutrition among children is spreading at record pace, and one of three below the age of two is now acutely malnourished.

item.title: Armani subsidiary shut down for ‘exploiting workers’
item.description: Italian police disclosed that Chinese workers employed by an unauthorised subcontractor, produced handbags and accessories for Giorgio Armani.

item.title: Sarajevo marks the 32nd anniversary of the city's siege
item.description: In Sarajevo, thousands of shoes have been carefully arranged along the city streets to remember those who perished during the Bosnian war.

item.title: 11,000 people evacuated due to imminent risk of flooding in Russia
item.description: Some 11,000 people have had to be evacuated after a dam broke in the city of Orsk, Russia which has a population of 190,000, on the border with Kazakhstan.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 6th – Midday
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: EU and Ukraine explore special tribunal for Putin and war officials
item.description: Vladimir Putin and other senior Russian political and military officials could have a special tribunal set up by the EU and Ukraine.

item.title: Lampedusa overwhelmed after receiving over 1000 migrants in a day
item.description: Italian authorities reported that just in a day and a half, more than 1500 people arrived to Lampedusa island, with 333 at the Friday morning alone.

item.title: Israel not doing enough to protect civilians, say UN and EU
item.description: UN and EU say that Israel does not take "adequate" measures to provide humanitarian aid and to protect civilian lives.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 6th – Morning
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: EU's most threatening criminal networks enter legal economy
item.description: Crime webs are penetrating legitimate businesses across the 27-nation bloc, relying heavily on corruption to develop their activities.

item.title: Amputee event in Baku raises awareness for International Mine Day
item.description: "Mines are a huge global problem," said Vugar Suleymanov, Chairman of the Board of the Mine Action Agency of Azerbaijan.

item.title: Poland's LGBT+ couples travel abroad to tie the knot
item.description: Poland's new government has promised a more inclusive law regulating civil partnerships, but this could still be a long way off.

item.title: Norway becomes latest European state to boost defence spending
item.description: Earlier this month, oil-rich Norway said it wants to increase the number of conscripted soldiers from 9,000 to 13,500 by 2036.

item.title: German synagogue attacked with incendiary device
item.description: Antisemitic attacks in Germany and elsewhere have surged since the start of the Israel Hamas war on 7 October.
